ygData.subject: Re: Guild Training
ygData.msgSnippet: That s not really true... they are allies, but you can t get training from a Paladin guildmaster.  As somebody else said though, in Freeport the Paladin s and
ygData.messageBody:
That's not really true... they are allies, but you can't get training from a Paladin guildmaster. As somebody else said though, in Freeport the Paladin's and the Clerics guild are in the same temple... and unless they are carrying a weapon that identifies them as a cleric or a paladin, it's not easy to tell which is which. If you go to a paladin guildmaster, they will still say you are not a paladin and refuse to help you. However, the person standing next to them may be a cleric... so you can train from them.

-Eachann Bronzeleaf,
-Cleric of Tunare, Tarew Marr

----- Original Message -----
From: Anne O <topaaz1@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, November 22, 1999 12:20 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Guild Training


> From: "Anne O" <topaaz1@...>
>
> someone prob alrdy ans this but, the clerics and the pally's are allys, so
> therefore you can tain at both guilds, that is why you usually allmost
> always find the cleric and payy guild in same building or very close
> togerher, i train at either, whichever i come to first =0)
> topaaz====xegony
>
> >From: "Marquardt, Kris L." <Kris_Marquardt@...>
> >Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com

> >
> >Last time I leveled I went back to Freeport to train. Not knowing the area
> >very well I managed to go to the Paladin's guild instead of the cleric's
> >guild without realizing it (yes, I know, not very clever but it was very
> >late). I located a trainer there and the system allowed her to train me.
> >Just curious if any one else has done this and if this might allow a player
> >to literally use any guild to train in. This has ,embarrassingly enough,
> >worked twice for me.
> >
> >Heisler
> >18th Lvl Dwarven Cleric of Brell
> >Armigers of Mirth, E'ci
